pitt.search.semanticvectors

Class TermVectorsFromLucene

  • java.lang.Object
    • pitt.search.semanticvectors.TermVectorsFromLucene

  • public class TermVectorsFromLucene
extends Object
    Implementation of vector store that creates term vectors by iterating through all the terms in a Lucene index. Uses a sparse representation for the basic document vectors, which saves considerable space for collections with many individual documents.
    Author:
    Dominic Widdows, Trevor Cohen.

      • createTermVectorsFromLucene

        public static TermVectorsFromLucene createTermVectorsFromLucene(FlagConfig flagConfig,
                                                                VectorStore elementalDocVectors)
                                                         throws IOException,
                                                                RuntimeException
        Creates term vectors from a Lucene index.
        Parameters:
        elementalDocVectors - The store of elemental document vectors. Null is an acceptable value, in which case the constructor will populate this store. If non-null, the identifiers must correspond to the Lucene doc numbers.
        Throws:
        IOException - if resources on disk cannot be opened.
        RuntimeException

      • createTermBasedRRIVectors

        public static TermVectorsFromLucene createTermBasedRRIVectors(FlagConfig flagConfig)
                                                       throws IOException,
                                                              RuntimeException
        Generates an elemental vector for each term. These elemental (random index) vectors will be used to construct document vectors, a procedure we have called term-based reflective random indexing.
        Throws:
        IOException
        RuntimeException
